metadata.synopsis: The Bhaal Temple is closed off by a massive door. They are 3 ways to open the door.1) with an Bhaal Amulet, given in the Serial Killer situation2) with invitation from Orin - which is given when players killed Gortash, after she has given the players the ultimatum3) if players are the Dark Urge, their butler will freely open the doors for the players.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1) Go to Act 3 -> UnderCity -> Bhaal Temple Bridge2a) Use oe BTGiveBhaalAmulet to give players Bhaal Amulet.or2b) Use oe BTSetKilledGortash to set players have killed Gortash so players are invited.2c) Players start as Dark Urge origins, and therefore their Butler will be at the door letting them in.3) Go to approach and 'speak' to the door.

3.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
3.text: Please bring forth the bearer of the Urge. Then we may all feast our eyes ogling their triumphs.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowlyNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowly

11.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
11.text: Oh, Master, Master, MASTER! You have come home to your royal dwelling!
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowlyNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowly

43.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
43.text: But why did you exert yourself so getting here? I was waiting to open the door.
43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

2.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
2.text: Don't lift a pinkie! I have been waiting to open the door for you.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

90.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
90.text: Lady Orin told me to allow your passage, but if she hadn't I would have been naughty and slipped you inside anyway.
90.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

47.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
47.text: Lady Orin told me not to let you in, but I'd never listen to the pretender to your fetid throne.
47.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

24.speaker: Player
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

97.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
97.text: Sceleritas Fel, at your service. A shame our paths have not crossed before, my Master, but now we need never part again.

29.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
29.text: I'm ever so saddened to hear of the trifling little bit of - pardon me - idiocy - that has been imposed upon your poor brain.

75.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
75.text: Just as I held the victim's nethers for your first castration, selected the scalpel for your first eye-gouging, and seasoned the first man you cooked alive, I will take care of you now.

109.speaker: Player
109.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
0.text: Before you go in, one last matter, my fetching felon.
0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Butler looks at you up and down.NodeContext: The butler pauses for a moment,  looking at you up and down

6.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
6.text: I see you are dressed in my raiment.

42.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
42.text: It is an honour that brings a weensy tear to Sceleritas' eye.
42.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge has the standard idle animation where they have their arms folded, looking cocky.

58.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
58.text: You should take it off, though. It would be improper to meet Lord Bhaal in the garb of a lowly servant.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge has the standard idle animation where they have their arms folded, looking cocky.

100.speaker: Player
100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge has the standard idle animation where they have their arms folded, looking cocky.

48.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
48.text: You truly are the wickeder sibling! I shall be punished for allowing your improper dress, I fear it already!
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Dark Urge has the standard idle animation where they have their arms folded, looking cocky.

44.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
44.text: There's a puddle of blood on the floor as you walk in, careful, don't slip!

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'm the child of Bhaal, I do as I please!

106.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
106.text: Eeek! Of course! Wear what you will.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I'll take it off before I go in.
108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cuts to the Butler, the Dark Urge will JUST end up having their hat off once gameplay starts, don't need to show the DU taking it off.

60.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
60.text: Very good. Every effort should be expended to make a good impression.
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Cuts to the Butler, the Dark Urge will JUST end up having their hat off once gameplay starts, don't need to show the DU taking it off.

21.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
21.text: A thousand succubae could give me no greater delight!

77.speaker: Player
77.text: What were you doing this whole time?

15.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
15.text: The Temple is all tidied and ready for your worshipful act of mortal combat!

89.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
89.text: The eye sockets of our graven god's icon are all polished up, ready to glow menacingly as you bludgeon your sister to death.

86.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
86.text: I've re-stacked every pile of skulls, and mounted more skeletons on the walls for a cosy touch.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: I went through the whole tribunal when you could have opened the door?!

78.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
78.text: I would have told you, but didn't dream of interrupting when you were enjoying yourself so!

107.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
107.text: Bashing the Hollyphant's wormy trunk was a particularly refined deed.

115.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
115.text: We are unfortunate bunkmates, as she refuses to leave your estate!

113.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
113.text: Every day she kills me as I'm trying to beautify the Temple for your return. Up to thrice, some days.

81.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
81.text: Being killed by you is so much more pleasurable, Master.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I'm not ready to go into the Temple yet.

28.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
28.text: Let's face facts, Master, you might never be.

4.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
4.text: But I believe in you, now and ever-after.

46.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
46.text: No! Don't leave me to pine!

27.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
27.text: Don't go, Master! Please... don't go.

17.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
17.text: Please go in, my Liege! And take care to watch your step!
17.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

31.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
31.text: We can play this game for as long as you wish. But please don't kill me again: I feel a blushing adulterer when I am not dying by Master's hand.
31.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

40.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
40.text: If you don't bring the Master soon, I'll put you on Slayer toenail clipping duties for a month.
40.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

117.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
117.text: Oh, I jest. I enjoy grooming the beast far too much to let you lay a hand on it.

71.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
71.text: No loitering, no lollygagging, and no trespassing. This is a private estate.
71.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

114.speaker: Player
114.text: But it belongs to Orin: she wishes to see me.
114.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

119.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
119.text: How dare you so much as whisper the name of that serf, that watery-blooded peasant who pretends to bear the Lord's name?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Who in the Nine Hells are you?
94.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
1.text: Ah, I am Sceleritas Fel: Butler of Bhaal. I live to die, and die to serve.
1.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

45.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
45.text: Although on this eve, I am rather the Doorbeast of Bhaal. I am getting anxious that my Liege is not here yet.
45.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

64.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
64.text: This Temple awaits the return of its true Master. A fellow of exceptional sin.
64.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

23.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
23.text: Unless Bhaal's true issue is brought before me, I shall not open the door. But you can bring them hither, can't you?
23.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

39.speaker: Player
39.text: Gods, are you the reason my friend is acting so strangely?
39.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

73.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
73.text: Your friend is special, ingrate, and you should consider yourself the luckiest wretch in the realms to travel with them.

57.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
57.text: Kindly assist the Master in returning home.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: I think that Bhaalspawn is one of my companions.
51.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

74.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
74.text: Hnhgh. I wish I had the honour you did of walking toe to toe, always on the very ground itself the Master treads on.
74.context: NodeContext: Quite into the idea of the ground the master walks on

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I've got the amulet, just move aside.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I've come to kill Orin, and I'll kill you if you get in my way.

33.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
33.text: Brute! It is your ally's destiny: the Chosen of Bhaal must kill their sibling. If your friend does not kill Orin, oh- don't even make me think of it! It's too sad.

41.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
41.text: You do not know Sceleritas. I get killed for fun.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I wish to enter in fear, and worship the Lord in his sanctum.

69.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
69.text: O, hail, brother, sister, or fellow bosom-cultist.

110.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
110.text: While I would love naught more than to join you in worship, Lord Bhaal requires your aid in another way first.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Can you open the door for me?

67.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
67.text: Have you no shame nor manners? This door will open only for one grafted from Bhaalian seed.

92.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
92.text: And in you, I detect scant evil seed.

50.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
50.text: One with such base manners as you is certainly unwelcome in my Liege's home.

80.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
80.text: Oh, you simply must go into the Temple, you must! My pattering heart cannot take it any longer!
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowlyNodeContext: Sceleritas bows lowly

84.speaker: Narrator
84.text: *Stone seals this chamber against the world.*
84.context: NodeContext: Growlingly unhappy to be back here

62.speaker: Player
62.text: This is a foul place, better buried. Already Boo is bristling - and not from the cold.
62.context: NodeContext: Growlingly unhappy to be back here

99.speaker: Minsc
99.text: This is a foul place, better buried. Already Boo is bristling - and not from the cold.
99.context: NodeContext: Growlingly unhappy to be back here

53.speaker: Player
53.text: I confess that the last time I came here, I thought it would be my tomb. You can see why.
53.context: InternalNodeContext: Knock functionality is removed for now. But could be put back in if needed. 03-03-2023

22.speaker: Player
22.text: I confess that the last time I came here, I thought it would be my tomb. You can see why.
22.context: InternalNodeContext: Knock functionality is removed for now. But could be put back in if needed. 03-03-2023

63.speaker: Jaheira
63.text: I confess that the last time I came here, I thought it would be my tomb. You can see why.
63.context: InternalNodeContext: Knock functionality is removed for now. But could be put back in if needed. 03-03-2023

14.speaker: Player
14.text: *You have Knocked but only a chill answered. The door is open.*
14.context: InternalNodeContext: Knock functionality is removed for now. But could be put back in if needed. 03-03-2023

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *You have Knocked but only a chill answered. The door is open.*
7.context: InternalNodeContext: Knock functionality is removed for now. But could be put back in if needed. 03-03-2023

20.speaker: Narrator
20.text: *With Gortash dead, Orin awaits you in the Temple's nauseating sanctum.*
20.context: InternalNodeContext: Ability to open the door by killing Gortash was removed after a flow review. 09-03-2023

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *The Bhaal Amulet trembles in frightened awe.*
82.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

93.speaker: Narrator
93.text: *No key, no handle. Better to forget. Better to live.*
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Utter a quick prayer to Bhaal.
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *Bhaal cares not for your empty words.*

104.speaker: Player
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *Murder, bloody murder. Who else but Bhaal would these symbols honour?*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *Murder, bloody murder. Who else but Bhaal would these symbols honour?*

87.text: *You do not discover truth, in these symbols you see only death.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *You do not discover truth, in these symbols you see only death.*

112.speaker: Player
112.text: Press the Amulet against the door.
112.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Will you return, once you cross this threshold?*
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

9.text: *Will you return, once you cross this threshold?*
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the Bhaal Amulet into the door.

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *Will you return, once you cross this threshold?*

79.text: *The amulet is gone from your possessions. You shall live another day.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *The amulet is gone from your possessions. You shall live another day.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *A chill draught strikes as you turn, as if distant eyes were set watching.*

88.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
88.text: Oh, you must be more of our dire Liege's servants. You are dressed in attire demonstrating your respect for the Master.

95.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
95.text: But why come to the Master's estate without them? Have you abandoned them? Or are you here to help with the skull-stacking and corpse-mounting?

61.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
61.text: If the latter, you are tardy. I've done all the work myself. Just go and fetch our honoured Bhaalspawn.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'll be back with the Urge.

30.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
30.text: The royal Itch, the regal Tingle, the unending Thirst. Oh, I adore them so.

98.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
98.text: Ooo, if you dare rob Master of their birthright, you will have Bhaal to answer to! As genocidal maniacs go, he is not the nicest!
